description: Numbers n such that n^3 has only odd digits.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..75
mathematica: fQ[n_] := Union@ OddQ@ IntegerDigits[n^3] == {True}; Select[2 Range[3*10^6] - 1, fQ] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 13 2011 *)Select[Range[12*10^6],AllTrue[IntegerDigits[#^3],OddQ]&] (* The program uses the AllTrue function from Mathematica version 10 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 14 2015 *)
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (intersect)a030099 n = a030099_list !! (n-1)a030099_list = filter (null . (intersect "86420") . show . (^ 3)) [1,3..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 13 2011
author: _Patrick De Geest_
